title: Add route protection for Admin page

requirements.text: Implement route protection in the Admin page component that redirects unauthenticated users to the home page (/) using React Router's useNavigate hook and useEffect

quotes: If user is NOT authenticated → redirect to "/"

acceptanceCriteria: When isAuthenticated is false, the Admin component immediately redirects to /
Redirection occurs before rendering any Admin page content
Uses React Router's navigate function from useNavigate()

requirements.text: Implement role-based access control in the Admin page component that redirects users with role !== 'admin' to the dashboard page (/dashboard) using React Router's useNavigate hook and useEffect
acceptanceCriteria: When user is authenticated but role is 'student', redirect to /dashboard
Only users with role === 'admin' can access the Admin page content
Redirection occurs before rendering any Admin page content

requirements.text: Consume isAuthenticated and role values from AuthContext using useAuth hook in the Admin page component to enable the protection logic
acceptanceCriteria: Admin component imports and uses useAuth hook from AuthContext
Both isAuthenticated and role values are destructured from useAuth()
Protection logic uses these values for redirect decisions

constraints: Do not modify the Navbar component or its conditional rendering logic
Do not modify the ProtectedRoute component
Do not modify any other page components (Home, Dashboard, About, Test, Result)
Do not modify the App.tsx routing configuration
Implement protection inside the Admin page component itself, not at the route level
nonGoals: Changing the existing ProtectedRoute component behavior
Adding new authentication logic to AuthContext
Hiding the Admin navigation link in the Navbar
Adding route guards at the App.tsx level
